title: Grades K-5: Level I, Novice Mid to Novice High Proficiency
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

96D7F5B7A241488797B4DD1DD024B7BC.description: describe people, objects, and simple situations orally and in writing using a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences.

784AD70A072149D384C38FCE0FC67AF8.description: state and support an opinion or preference orally and in writing; and

B549B1CA360A4987A322AC489E234B3E.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally and in writing using a mixture of words and phrases and some simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

D46D2565155A403E96A5F51F5EBB9172.description: identify cultural practices from authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials.

D7FA8B0B3BBD4E83BC909906FBC4910E.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, and audiovisual materials; and

5EA34A7955634993BC70EDBCEA0A73DD.description: identify key words and details from fiction and nonfiction texts and audio and audiovisual materials;

803E586480AE446D9493FAC4DCD7F4ED.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials in everyday contexts;

AE37F35916614E598B7A085EC5DBB341.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends sentence-length information from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within highly contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

B6FDC3EC83054361BECF7A8D43CF66E1.description: participate in written conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and style.

2120A8A1850744D396417791B88ADCBD.description: participate in spoken conversation using culturally appropriate expressions, register, and gestures; and

3E226ACE342F49E5A30EF42192E99B6F.description: articulate requests, offer alternatives, or develop simple plans in spoken and written conversation;

A88B3FC8E1264CD9A466AAAB8B13A8D6.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do in spoken and written conversation;

27E8F93E262D44F3A555B60676C9B569.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences in spoken and written conversation;

3187C90E64204C408F4C28A767C195A0.description: ask and respond to questions about everyday life in spoken and written conversation;

4471B15AB6A748E899976D2D70EFDAB0.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in rehearsed and unrehearsed situations in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words and phrases and some simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

CF2CEB1E3BE9428BAAC005FE36943522.description: Level I, Novice Mid to Novice High Proficiency
